revised_title: Investigating the Mechanisms of Haemolysis by Anionic Detergents
tldr: The authors studied the kinetics of haemolysis of human red blood cells by anionic detergents and discovered that these detergents can destroy red cells through two mechanisms. The first mechanism involves the action of the detergent on free phospholipid in the cell wall, while the second mechanism is similar to how most haemolytic agents act. The study provides insights into the structure and maintenance of the red blood cell wall and the equilibria involved.
